question: Who said that “We must deal wisely with the world’s largest democracy... We need to work harder and more consistently to assist India... while not neglecting our friends in Pakistan”?
explanation: No wonder the Indian constituency felt reassured by Secretary of State Colin Powell’s observation in his confirmation hearing before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee that India is “a country that should grow more and more focused in the lens of our foreign policy”. He held that need to work harder and more consistently to assist India in this endeavour, while not neglecting our friends in Pakistan.
